com.opengamma.strata.product

Interface Security<P extends Product>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the product
    All Superinterfaces:
    Attributable, Bean, IdentifiableBean, StandardIdentifiable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UnitSecurity

    public interface Security<P extends Product>
extends IdentifiableBean, Attributable
    A single security.

    A security is one of the building blocks of finance, representing a fungible instrument that can be traded. This is intended to cover instruments such as listed equities and futures. It is intended that Over-The-Counter (OTC) instruments, such as an interest rate swap, are embedded directly within the trade, rather than handled as one-off securities.

    When referring to a security from another object, such as an underlying on a more complex trade, consideration should be given to using SecurityLink.

    Implementations of this interface must be immutable beans.

    • Method Detail

      • getStandardId

        StandardId getStandardId()
        The primary standard identifier for the security.

        The standard identifier is used to identify the security. It will typically be an identifier in an external data system.

        A security may have multiple active identifiers. Any identifier may be chosen here. Certain uses of the identifier, such as storage in a database, require that the identifier does not change over time, and this should be considered best practice.

        Specified by:
        getStandardId in interface StandardIdentifiable
        Returns:
        the identifier

      • getAttributes

        ImmutableMap<String,String> getAttributes()

        Attributes are typically used to tag the object with additional information.

        Specified by:
        getAttributes in interface Attributable
        Returns:
        the complete set of attributes

      • getProduct

        P getProduct()
        Gets the product underlying the security.

        All securities refer to a single underlying product. The product captures the financial details of the security contract.

        Returns:
        the product
